snippet: Pitcher Ron Guidry, who wound up playing in center field at Yankee Stadium on two occasions, understood why Mariano Rivera enjoyed shagging fly balls during practice.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball column on former New York Yankees pitcher Ron Guidry's reaction to news of Yankees closer Mariano Rivera's season-ending injury while shagging fly balls in the outfield before a game. Photo (M)4
lead_paragraph: Ron Guidry understood perfectly. He knew why Mariano Rivera loved shagging fly balls during batting practice and why Rivera's dream has been to play center field before his certain first-ballot Hall of Fame career was over. When he was pitching to the nickname of Louisiana Lightning, Guidry not only had the same daily routine, he actually got to play one and a third innings in the most hallowed of Yankee Stadium positions spread over two memorable (for him) occasions.

headline.main: Guidry Can Relate to the Allure of the Outfield
